title: FY2024 prisoner operations details

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FY2024 prisoner operations details
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

(1) any record(s) detailing the average daily population of all individuals remanded to the custody of the U.S. Marshals Service in FY 2025 (or most recent fiscal year for which records are available), disaggregated or broken down by:
(a) sex; 
(b) most serious offense or charge (if that is not possible, then by offense category, i.e. violent, property, drugs, other new offense, weapons, immigration, supervision, material witness, etc.); 
(c) case status (i.e., convicted or unconvicted, or sentenced or unsentenced); 
(d) both sex and most serious offense (or if that is not possible, then by offense category) – i.e., the number of females in custody for each offense type and the number of males in custody for each offense type;
(e) both sex and case status (convicted or unconvicted, or sentenced or unsentenced) – i.e. the number of females in custody who are sentenced versus unsentenced and the number of males in custody who are sentenced versus unsentenced; and
(f) type of facility (i.e., state correctional facility, local correctional facility, privately owned or operated facilities, Federal Bureau of Prisons facilities, hospitals, or other).

If records are unavailable for the average daily population, records reporting the same information for any single day after January 1, 2024 (or the most recent day for which records are available) would be acceptable. Similarly, I would prefer records that contain this information reported as counts (totals), but if such records are unavailable, records reporting the same information by percent (percent of total) would be acceptable. I would also prefer the information be sent via email in PDF format, but would accept other electronic formats. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

I agree to pay any reasonable copying and postage fees of not more than $25. If the cost would be greater than this amount, please notify me. Please provide a receipt indicating the charges for each document. 

If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial, including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) upon which you rely. Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Wendy Sawyer

title: Documents (emails,proposals, plans, etc) related to 6651 E Vernor - Department of Planning and Development

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Documents (emails,proposals, plans, etc) related to 6651 E Vernor - Department of Planning and Development
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all of the following documents from the Department of Planning and Development, from January 1, 2010 to December 31, 2025 related to the property with the parcel ID: 15011719 or address 6651 East Vernor Highway:
1. Emails and other correspondence, including attachments, between agency staff and Patrick McCabe and/or his representatives regarding the sale of this parcel.
2. Proposals for use of lot including schedule, architectural renderings
3. Terms of sale, including use, timeline and scheduled check-ins

This includes but is not limited to documents containing the following information:
1. architectural schematics
2. reference photos
3. plans for the property
4. any emails between the agency and other parties interested in purchasing the property since 2017
5. timeline for improvement
6. any conditions (beyond payment) for McCabe's purchase of the land.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tracie McMillan

title: Booking contracts for IBJJF Boston tournaments

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Booking contracts for IBJJF Boston tournaments
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

- booking contracts for upcoming IBJJF events
- contracts and reconciliation documents for past IBJJF events

The IBJJF is hosting a series of Brazilian Jiu Jitsu tournaments at the Reggie Lewis Track & Athletic Center: https://www.rcc.mass.edu/reggie-lewis/events-schedule.html#events/search/ibjjf. Please include all of these, as well as any events held in 2025.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Amico

title: Records pertaining to Executive Order 14253 of March 27, 2025 (Department of Interior, Office of the Secretary)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act and  Smithsonian Directive 807, I hereby request any and all records on Executive Order 14253 "Restoring Truth and Sanity to American History which was issued on March 27, 2025 and Department of the Interior  Secretary Order 3431 . I request any and all relevant records beginning on January 20, 2025 to the most recent records available. These records include, at a minimum: interagency emails discussing the order or its implementation; Draft guidance or policy memoranda; meeting agendas, minutes, or notes; Internal reviews or risk assessments related to exhibits or historical interpretations; and communications, directives, or planning docs from the President's or Vice-President's office related to the order; records of meetings or coordination with Smithsonian leadership or other agencies/





The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes therefore I request a waiver of any and all fees.

title: Untitled

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Daily snapshots of the Motor Carrier Census file (also known as Company Census or MCS-150 data) for the period January 1, 2000  through January 27, 2026.   If daily snapshots are not available, I would be interested in monthly or quarterly snapshots.  

Fields of interest (standard census fields):                                                                                                       
  - DOT_NUMBER                                                                                                                                       
  - LEGAL_NAME, DBA_NAME                                                                                                                             
  - PHY_STREET, PHY_CITY, PHY_STATE, PHY_ZIP                                                                                                         
  - NBR_POWER_UNIT (power units)                                                                                                                     
  - DRIVER_TOTAL (drivers)                                                                                                                           
  - MCS150_MILEAGE, MCS150_MILEAGE_YEAR                                                                                                              
  - CARRIER_OPERATION (interstate/intrastate)                                                                                                        
  - CARGO types (CRGO_* fields)                                                                                                                      
  - Authority status fields                                                                                                                          
  - MCS150_DATE (filing date)                                                                                                                        

Preferred format: CSV, pipe-delimited text, or any machine-readable format.                                                                        

Please note that this request has been made numerous times per a review of FOIA logs, specifically FMCS-2023-05358, FMCS-2023-03393, FMCS-2023-03511 in FY2023, and also in previous years.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ian White

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Westchester County Police Department)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Westchester County Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: Open Records Request PIR26-0080
communications.communication:
Dear MuckRock Representative Samuel Sinyangwe,
This e-mail is in response to your open records request, assigned PIR25-0080.
The purpose of this e-mail is to seek clarification and narrow your request to specific records.
You did not provide the requisite information or enough specific information in order for this agency to perform an accurate search for records.
If you do not have the case/report numbers, please provide the following:

  *
Exact date(s)
  *
Specific location/address
  *
Approximate time frame of each incident(s)
  *
Names of person depicted

This agency does not obtain search abilities for all "use of force incidents," in any date range.
Once you provide enough information in order for this agency to perform an accurate search for records, only public information will be released which includes, mugshots, press releases, arrest sheets, warrants, probable case warrant affidavits and a basic coversheet and a basic public narrative under the Limitations on the Scope.
Digital evidence and records beyond the Limitations on the Scope are not included in public information under law relating to active offense reports of an arrested individual under TGC Sec. 552.108(c).
Any requests seeking records beyond a public copy will be submitted to the Texas Office of the Attorney General in Austin. I will claim all applicable exceptions under law, seeking to withhold the records from public disclosure. The TxOAG will render a ruling within 45 to 55-business days. This process can take up to 90-business days to complete. Charges apply pending the TxOAG ruling.
Please respond and clarify/narrow your request within 61-days and advise me of how you wish for me to proceed, ie: (Please include if you seek the public copies in accordance with state exceptions, or do you seek a ruling from the TxOAG and agree to said charges?). Failure to respond within 61-days will result in an automatic withdraw of your request under TGC Sec. 552.222. If you wish to discuss how I may assist you in narrowing your request, please feel free to reach out and I will be happy to accommodate you. Please clarify and state if you seek the public copies under the exceptions listed within state law or if you seek a ruling submission from the Texas Office of the Attorney General in Austin. (public copies under 50-pages are provided electronically via e-mail at no charge). We do not waive open records/public information processing charges. We do not access links or attachments from outside sources for security reasons. We do not obtain drop box or similar access to our records.
If you have further inquiries or questions, please feel free to contact me and I will be happy to assist or direct you.
Texas' open records laws are promulgated and set forth by Texas Legislature under the Texas Public Information Act. You may find a current version free-of-charge in .pdf format, desktop downloadable version on the Texas Office of the Attorney General's Website under the open government tab. You may also find all rights, mandates, requirements and regulations for both the requestor and governmental bodies on this site.
Respectfully,
Deputy Danie Huffman
Public Information Officer
Parker County Sheriff's Office
(682) 229-2358
[cid:ab3d4775-302d-4692-919b-e95b8ba941ee]

communications.subject: Fw: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Greene County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
Good Morning,


    I am providing you with an excerpt from the Public Records Policy passed by the Greene County Legislative Body regarding your public records request please see below:



Requests for copies of records must be made in writing. Persons requesting to inspect or copy records must show identification of Tennessee citizenship with a government-issued photo identification card  including the person's address (i.e., driver's license, voter's registration, etc.),



I will be happy to start the process of copying these records for your requested information once you send me a copy of your government issued photo identification.


Also, it will take some time to process your request due to some of the records being stored at a different location.  These records are on a paper format and will not be able to be sent electronically.  There will be a cost for this amount of paper and also an hourly rate assessed for the time to make these copies.




I Look forward to your response.

communications.subject: FOIA Request
communications.communication:
MuckRock News

 

RE: FOIA Requested dated 01/28/2026

 

Sir

 

I have received your request dated 01/28/2026, requesting Use of force (UFO)
from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025.  Our internal reference number
for this request is FOIA 2026-0133.

 

Ark. Code Ann. 25-19-105(a)(1)(A), also known as the "Arkansas Freedom of
Information Act of 1967", stated "Except as otherwise specifically provided
by this section or by laws specifically enacted to provide otherwise, all
public records shall be open to inspection and copying by any citizen of the
State of Arkansas during the regular business hours of the custodian of
records."  As you ae not a citizen of the State of Arkansas YOUR REQUEST IS
DENIED.

 

If you feel this determination was made in error, please submit a notarized
affidavit indicating your personal residential address proving Arkansas
citizenship.  If you require any further assistance, please fell free to
contact me.  Thank you.

 

Respectfully

 



Dep. Wayne Bean 

Public Information Assistant 

Saline County Sheriff's Office

735 S. Neeley ST

Benton, AR 72015

foiarequest@scsosheriff.org

501-303-5609 Ext. 1500

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Fayette County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Whitfield County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
Good morning,

I am in receipt of your request.  Please note that our agency only became equipped with a tracking system for Use of Force in 2021.  Spreadsheets for the UOF are available, however, not in the format as you have listed in your request.  UOF reports, which provide further detail, may also be provided.  There will be a charge to fulfill this request.  The first fifteen (15) minutes of research are free.  A fee of twenty dollars ($20.00) an hour will accrue for further.

O.C.G.A. §50-18-71 Right of access; timing; fees; denial of requests; impact of electronic records
(c)

  *   (1) An agency may impose a reasonable charge for the search, retrieval, redaction, and production or copying costs for the production of records pursuant to this article. An agency shall utilize the most economical means reasonably calculated to identify and produce responsive, nonexcluded documents. Where fees for certified copies or other copies or records are specifically authorized or otherwise prescribed by law, such specific fee shall apply when certified copies or other records to which a specific fee may apply are sought. In all other instances, the charge for the search, retrieval, or redaction of records shall not exceed the prorated hourly salary of the lowest paid full-time employee who, in the reasonable discretion of the custodian of the records, has the necessary skill and training to perform the request; provided, however, that no charge shall be made for the first quarter hour.

Please let me know if you would like to proceed further with the request.


Thank you,

Marcy Cochran
Internal Affairs Coordinator
Whitfield County Sheriff’s Office
805 Professional Boulevard
Dalton, GA 30720
mcochran@whitfieldcountyga.com<mailto:mcochran@whitfieldcountyga.com>
Direct:  706-876-1429
Main:  706-278-3029

communications.subject: Re: South Carolina Public Records Law Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Kershaw County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
Good morning,
I'm the General Counsel for the Kershaw County Sheriff's office. I've received your FOIA request for use of force records, and I have a couple of follow-up questions. We charge $15 per hour to retrieve and redact records. If you'd like to proceed with the request we can talk about the different classes of records and how long it will take to collect them. We've gone through a few different data systems in that period of time.

The other issue is South Carolina's FOIA statute creates a system for citizens to learn and report the activities of public officials. We are unable to provide a FOIA response to out of state inquiries.

If you're interested in this information, please give me a call at 803 554 9123, and I may be able to provide an alternative route.

Thanks for your time,
Jason Allen

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Clinton County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
Greetings,
                After reviewing this further, this request will be time intensive.

Some background information for you. In NY we are required to submit Use of force reports to Albany DCJS monthly. This is law and required and completed online. We in Clinton County do NOT keep a database or spread sheet of any use of force.

Based on our Records Management System and Jail Management System, we cannot search only for use of force incidents.

You are also asking for several years’ worth of reports from 1/1/2017 until now.

After discussions, it appears that this could take a minimum of 210 days for the lowest paid, competent person to identify, redact and prepare these documents from each division. There are roughly 21,000 Patrol incidents that need to be hand reviewed to determine if there is a use of force. This would take the lowest paid person roughly 8 hours to review 100 reports and correlate the data. You are then asking for 210 days’ worth of work, at $23.90 and hour. This is 1680 hours which equals to $40,152.00.


I am working on the estimate for the jail at this time.



( See NY CLS Public Officers law , Art 6 FOIL (c)  In determining the actual cost of reproducing a record, an agency may include only:

i.  an amount equal to the hourly salary attributed to the lowest paid agency employee who has the necessary skill required to prepare a copy of the requested record;

ii.  the actual cost of the storage devices or media provided to the person making the request in complying with such request;



I have been advised that I would need you to agree to the cost of the FOIL, and pay prior to directive that the extensive work to be done.





I should also note as stated above. NYS DCJS and NYS Commission on Corrections both are repositories for this exact data and have it in an electronic format.



Please advise if you wish to move forward or rescind your request.



Thanks much.



Major Nicholas J Leon
Chief Deputy
Clinton County Sheriff's Office
Patrol Division
Northern Regional Special Response Team
25 McCarthy DrivePlattsburgh, NY 12901
(518) 565-4214 Office
(518) 565-4371 Fax
 [cid:image001.jpg@01DC902B.F5E1ED50]

If you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any disclosure, copying, distribution, or the taking of any action in reliance on the contents of this e-mail or any attachment is strictly prohibited.
